title: Practice Challenge
description: Apply what you've learned in this interactive coding challenge.
instructions:
Set up Scalar documentation for a Movie API!

1. Add OpenAPI and Scalar services
2. Configure Scalar with:
   - Title: 'Movie Database API'
   - Theme: DeepSpace (dark theme)
   - Dark mode enabled
   - Default client: Python

3. Create these documented endpoints:
   - GET /movies - List all movies
   - GET /movies/{id} - Get movie by ID
   - GET /movies/search?genre=&year= - Search movies
   - POST /movies - Add new movie

4. Each endpoint needs WithName, WithSummary, WithDescription, WithTags

5. Create Movie record: Id, Title, Genre, Year, Rating

6. Print the Scalar UI URL when app starts

hints.text: Add 'using Scalar.AspNetCore;' at the top for Scalar extensions.
WithSummary is short (shown in list), WithDescription is longer (shown when expanded).
Scalar UI is at /scalar/v1 by default. Print this URL for easy access.

commonMistakes.mistake: Forgetting to call MapOpenApi before MapScalarApiReference
commonMistakes.consequence: Scalar needs the OpenAPI spec! Without MapOpenApi(), Scalar has no documentation to display.

commonMistakes.mistake: Missing the using statement for Scalar.AspNetCore
commonMistakes.consequence: Extension methods like WithTitle, WithTheme won't be available.
commonMistakes.correction: Add 'using Scalar.AspNetCore;' at the top of your file.

commonMistakes.consequence: Summary appears in endpoint list, Description appears in expanded view. Wrong placement = poor UX.
commonMistakes.correction: Summary: 3-5 words (like a headline). Description: Full explanation of endpoint behavior.

commonMistakes.mistake: Not installing the Scalar.AspNetCore NuGet package
commonMistakes.consequence: MapScalarApiReference method won't exist. Compile error.
